item.title: Transport Layer Security (5/6)
item.description: In this article, we examine the gory details of a TLS session, down to every byte exchanged. If you've ever wondered how the Web is secured, this one's for you.

item.title: Retrieving the Spanish Wordle Wordlist
item.description: It's as stupid as the title sounds.

item.title: The Domain Name System (6/6)
item.description: How does your computer figure out the IP address for a given domain? Let's find out.

item.title: Dissecting a Log4Shell Attack
item.description: Ever since the beginning, Log4Shell has been inseperably tied to Minecraft servers. In this post, I take apart one such attack and see what makes it tick.

item.title: The Internet, Explained (1/6)
item.description: When you type a URL into your browser, how does that data get from your computer to the server? In this post, we explore the crazy magic behind the Internet.

item.title: Reviving egg-kernel
item.description: After over a year of hiatus, it is time to once again breathe some life into my x86 kernel project. Hopefully, this attempt will not prove to be dead on arrival.
